item.title: ashleyrebeccah add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "you got to figure out which end of the needle you’re gon be, the one that’s fastened to the thread or the end that pierces the cloth." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: ashleyrebeccah add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "I’d chosen the regret I could live with best, that’s all. I’d chosen the life I belonged to." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: ashleyrebeccah add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: " Loneliness is the human condition. Cultivate it. The way it tunnels into you allows your soul room to grow. Never expect to outgrow loneliness. Never hope to find people who will understand you, someone to fill that space. An intelligent, sensitive person is the exception, the very great exception. If you expect to find people who will understand you, you will grow murderous with disappointment. The best you'll ever do is to understand yourself, know what it is that you want, and not let the cattle stand in your way." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: ashleyrebeccah add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "Remember it all, every insult, every tear. Tattoo it on the inside of your mind. In life, knowledge of poisons is essential. I've told you, nobody becomes an artist unless they have to." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: ashleyrebeccah add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "The phoenix must burn to emerge." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: ashleyrebeccah add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "You've got to let go of who you were, to become who you will be." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: ashleyrebeccah add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "I hated labels anyway. People didn't fit in slots--prostitute, housewife, saint--like sorting the mail. We were so mutable, fluid with fear and desire, ideals and angles, changeable as water." -- Janet Fitch
